item.title: Monsters droping nothign
item.dc:creator: @chassy13 Chassy13
item.description:
@chassy13 wrote:

Sigh. Although this might be a bit messy code, it should work.

Declare this:

public int resetDropTimer = 1500;

You change this integer to what you desire, the higher the number the longer the wait to have the drops reset.

Then search for

public void process() {

Under it add this:

[code]if(resetDropTimer <= 1500) {
resetDropTimer–;
}

if(resetDropTimer <= 0) {
customCommand(“commandname”);
resetDropTimer = 1500;
}[/code]

You must replace the commandname to the name of the command that jc gave you. Do not remove the quotes.

Also, if you change the integer ‘resetDropTimer’, you will probably need to make changes to the methods that are going in process.

If you want a simple command that will tell you the seconds left:

if(command.equals("timeleft")) { sendMessage("There are "+ resetDropTimer +" seconds left."); }

I really can’t explain it more from there, sorry. If you get any errors I can help you though.

Read full topic

item.title: Monsters droping nothign
item.dc:creator: @chassy13 Chassy13
item.description:
@chassy13 wrote:

If you are one of those people who doesn’t like processing crap, then I suggest you don’t make one. A simple one would be something like this:

Declare:

public int resetDropTimer = ####;

then in your process method:

[code]if(resetDropTimer <= ####) {
resetDropTimer–;
}

if(resetDropTimer <= 0) {
customCommand(“commandname”);
}[/code]

That would be a basic start, although there are a lot of different ways and things you could probably add.

Read full topic

item.title: Monsters droping nothign
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

Go to your ItemHandler class and add this method -

public static void resetItemDrop() { for(int i = 0; i <= 2000000; i++) { globalItemID[i] = 0; } }

And then, find -

public static int[] globalItemID = new int

You should see this -

public static int[] globalItemID = new int[####];

Change that to this -

public static int[] globalItemID = new int[2000001];

Save, compile, run.
Reply with errors.

Read full topic

Note: Recompile with -Xlint:deprecation for details. 2 errors Press any key to continue . . .

item.title: Monsters droping nothign
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

Add this to your client class, under your customCommand void -

if(command.startsWith("NAME")) { ItemHandler.resetItemDrop(); yell("Drops are now reset and working!"); }

Reply with any errors.

Read full topic
